summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Logs for August 9, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, staff shortages, and equipment status. It is significant as it documents the facility's operations on the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death, showing inmates on suicide watch and a dry cell placement.

persons.name: Garcia-Pena
persons.context: Listed as the Operations Lieutenant/Acting Lieutenant who signed off on the administrative detention order for an inmate in Unit KN at 8:28 PM.

persons.name: Hussey
persons.context: An inmate (Reg #55210-053) who was moved from location E02-5130 to 'PRE REMOVE' at 8:38 AM during the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Daily Correctional Facility Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at MCC New York including inmate counts, staff assignments, equipment checks, and inmate movements. Notable entries include inmates on suicide watch, a dry cell placement, and staff shortages leading to vacated posts.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate was placed on a dry cell in the R&D holding cell with staff watch during the Evening Watch shift.

events.title: Multiple Inmates on Suicide Watch
events.description: The log repeatedly notes inmates on suicide watch, some with inmate companions, across all three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch).

events.title: Administrative Detention Order
events.description: Inmate Garcia-Pena (Reg #79043-054) was placed in Administrative Detention in Unit KN at 8:28 PM for reason code 331.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This document records the daily operations of MCC New York on August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
The log shows multiple inmates were on suicide watch with inmate companions throughout the day.
An inmate was placed in a 'dry cell' in the R&D holding area under staff watch.
The report notes chronic staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments (like phone monitor, recreation officers, and SHU posts).
The Control Center Fire Panel is noted as inoperative, and there were system malfunctions preventing PREA announcements.
